result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Michael Riggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 12:11 PM Defendant Jordan Michael Riggs in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Jordan Michael Riggs.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to counts two and three. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders Count two-150 days Jail and Count three-90 Days Jail, concurrent with each other and 22CM320, with Full Huber and Diversion, Defendant to contact diversion by October 19 2022 and report no later than December 13 2022. Court costs due December 16 2022  5 Days credit.  Count one is dismissed and read in.
